commit_message:
Bump diskimage-builder to 2.30.0 in UC

Diskimage-builder (DIB) is a branch-less project. Unfortunately pip
made a change that required a modification to DIB[1]. This patch was
first released in DIB 2.30.0.
To fix image building on the OpenStack stable branches, we need to
bump diskimage-builder to 2.30.0 in the upper-constraints.txt of
the stable OpenStack releases.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695823/

Change-Id: I6901c00aa7a59848b6f4417128f9ad7000383aac

commit_message:
Remove six usage

This repo does not support Python 2 anymore, so we don't need
six for compatibility between Python2 and 3, convert six usage to Python
3 code.

Change-Id: I3edab6e67ac79d14fe9d38f6f75abfd50030fa1e
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/701743

commit_message:
Add cli playbook to retrieve the horizon url

This playbook will retrieve the horizon url from a heat stack and store it in
a temp file which can be used within the tripleoclient when displaybin the
url data.

Change-Id: I85cb99d47cf3cb4f3093fc856e9f6892115ff5ef
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add 'dataclasses'

The dataclasses library has been added to the standard library in Python
3.7 [1]. The minimum version of Python used in Ussuri is Python 3.6, but
a rolling backport package is available on PyPI. Add this.

- Is the library actively maintained?
  Yes. It is a rolling backport for Python 3.7 only maintained by the
  developer of this feature now found in the stdlib.
  See https://pypi.org/project/dataclasses/

- Is the library good code?
  Yes. It has since been merged to the Python stdlib.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?
  Yes. Only for Python 3.6.

- Is the library license compatible?
  Yes (Apache-2.0)

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
  (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
  No.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
  global-requirements.txt
  No.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup?
  Yes. We want to use this functionality in nova.

- Do I need to update anything else?
  No.

Change-Id: Ie4337fd7d2ed18b1f16a18102d7fb925e04144e3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-05 10:41:15.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/scenario/test_share_manage_unmanage.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/commit/820064b6d7c4a39a39400c11a3c138d6bf4d9074', 'message': 'Fix resources cleanup

When running "test_create_manage_and_write" test with
default share type (i.e. set default_share_type_name
= default in tempest.conf) it passed, however, when
there is no default share type it failed with
"Target share type is still in use."
This is because the failed managed share is not deleted
before the share type it is based on.
This patch makes sure the manila share is deleted before
its share type.

Change-Id: I1ba4ae3dcc274bf5e6dee5320e52117f440ebb5d
Related-bug: #1862001
'}]
commit_message:
Fix resources cleanup

When running "test_create_manage_and_write" test with
default share type (i.e. set default_share_type_name
= default in tempest.conf) it passed, however, when
there is no default share type it failed with
"Target share type is still in use."
This is because the failed managed share is not deleted
before the share type it is based on.
This patch makes sure the manila share is deleted before
its share type.

Change-Id: I1ba4ae3dcc274bf5e6dee5320e52117f440ebb5d
Related-bug: #1862001

commit_message:
[Queens-only] Remove extra $ from KEYSTONE_BOOTSTRAP_PASSWORD variable.

This allows it to actually be evaluated/rendered.

Change-Id: Ifa98821f145a229dde5c070e122819aa68b7a8dd
Closes-Bug: #1861248
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/24/704724/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [ 'keystone', '/usr/bin/bootstrap_host_exec', 'keystone' ,'keystone-manage', 'bootstrap', '--bootstrap-password', '$KEYSTONE_BOOTSTRAP_PASSWORD' ]

subject: Fix boot_roles in InstanceSystemMetadata
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-09 16:18:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0754c97544c5bb7c7fa5c21292a10207966e0516', 'message': 'Fix boot_roles in InstanceSystemMetadata

The "value" attribute of the InstanceSystemMetadata SQL table is a String
of length 255 currently, which is not long enough to contain a list of
roles ("boot_roles") which can easily exceed 255 characters when you have
a Rapid RBAC user who has multiple roles (17 roles in the case of the
sample Rapid RBAC group that we have defined). "boot_roles" is part of the
system-generated metadata belonging to each server instance created.

The solution is to break the role list into multiple metadata items in
the database. When the role list is retrieved by the user/vendor, the role
list is reconstructed.

Co-Authored-By: CLIFF PARSONS <cliff.parsons@att.com>

Change-Id: I057b46c4af384fd0836cd973a5998fe3bcb56175

commit_message:
Fix boot_roles in InstanceSystemMetadata

The "value" attribute of the InstanceSystemMetadata SQL table is a String
of length 255 currently, which is not long enough to contain a list of
roles ("boot_roles") which can easily exceed 255 characters when you have
a Rapid RBAC user who has multiple roles (17 roles in the case of the
sample Rapid RBAC group that we have defined). "boot_roles" is part of the
system-generated metadata belonging to each server instance created.

The solution is to break the role list into multiple metadata items in
the database. When the role list is retrieved by the user/vendor, the role
list is reconstructed.

Co-Authored-By: CLIFF PARSONS <cliff.parsons@att.com>
Closes-Bug: 1855749
Change-Id: I057b46c4af384fd0836cd973a5998fe3bcb56175
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/698040/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_boot_roles(self): """Get boot roles from instance system metadata If the boot_roles dictionary in the system metadata were stored in multiple keys, then the entries need to be consolidated into one string. Otherwise, just pull the boot_roles string from the dictionary. For example, if there were a large number of roles, the database record may look like: { ... 'boot_roles': 'role1,role2,.....,role15,' 'boot_roles1': 'role16,role17,...,role21,' 'boot_roles2': 'role22' ... } Then the boot_roles string returned from this function would be: 'role1,role2,...,role15,role16,role17,...,role21,role22' """ i = 0 done = False boot_roles_string = "" while not done: key = "boot_roles" if i > 0: key = key + str(i) substring = self.instance.system_metadata.get(key, '') if substring != '': boot_roles_string = boot_roles_string + substring i = i + 1 else: done = True return boot_roles_string 'boot-roles': self._get_boot_roles()}

commit_message:
Switch from oslosphinx to openstackdocstheme

That's what the OpenStack community is using today. Also with newer
Sphinx versions, the current approach does no longer build.

Change-Id: Iab9f72bb146e8dd36de7fa868b41801e0c97e2ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-dracclient refs/changes/12/687012/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt commands = sphinx-build -b html doc/source doc/build/html

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Unisphere storage group/array tagging support

This feature allows the user to tag a storage group and/or an
array in Unisphere with a user defined tag, to facilitate easy
access and classification.

Change-Id: Ifaf66360a604df55be8c0c197de6d9f1bf3cc9f6

commit_message:
governance/releases consistency check tool

Introduce a new tool to list inconsistencies between projects.yaml
in governance repository and deliverables in the releases repository.

Sometimes projects.yaml defines release-managed deliverables, but the
release team is not handling them. Sometimes, the release management
team handles deliverables which are not officially produced by an
OpenStack project team, and should probably not be listed on releases.o.o.

This tool lists both types of inconsistencies, and can be integrated
to release management process so that they are handled before becoming
an issue.

NB: Once ready, this tool could be used to replace the "membership
freeze check" tool which only looked at some of those inconsistencies.

Change-Id: Id263f0c91f872111fe997e2b8a1088b61033d114
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/17/698717/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python3 # # List inconsistencies between repositories under governance and # deliverable files # # Copyright 2019 Thierry Carrez <thierry@openstack.org> # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import argparse import os.path import sys import yaml # Infrastructure/OpenDev repositories escape OpenStack release management TEAM_EXCEPTIONS = ['Infrastructure'] def deliv_in_governance(args): deliv = set() with open(args.projects_yaml, 'r') as projects: teams = yaml.safe_load(projects) for tname, team in teams.items(): if tname in TEAM_EXCEPTIONS: continue for dname, deliverable in team['deliverables'].items(): if 'release-management' in deliverable: continue deliv.add(dname) return deliv def deliv_in_releases(args): deliv = set() for dirname in [args.series, '_independent']: dirpath = os.path.join('./deliverables', dirname) for filename in os.listdir(dirpath): delivname = os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(filename))[0] deliv.add(delivname) return deliv def main(args=sys.argv[1:]): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser() parser.add_argument( 'series', help='name of the currently-developed series' ) parser.add_argument( 'projects_yaml', help='path to governance projects.yaml file' ) parser.add_argument( '--reverse', action="store_true", help='Find deliverables released but not in governance' ) args = parser.parse_args(args) print("Defined in governance but not in deliverable files:") print(" (excluding deliverables from " + str(TEAM_EXCEPTIONS) + " team(s)") print(" and deliverables specifically marked as being externally managed)") print() for d in deliv_in_governance(args) - deliv_in_releases(args): print('- ' + d) print() print("Defined in deliverable files but not in (active) governance:") print() for d in deliv_in_releases(args) - deliv_in_governance(args): print('- ' + d) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-05 17:33:32.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/_exts/deliverables.py', 'doc/source/reference/using.rst', 'openstack_releases/deliverable.py', 'deliverables/_independent/pbr.yaml', 'openstack_releases/schema.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/80a06163590087f94218ba1034a1c32f669836ea', 'message': 'Skip sig links if the skipped-sig flag is set

In releases.o.o we display signature links for all deliverables,
if the series is > Ocata or independent. Since some "independent"
deliverables predate the signature generation tooling, that results
in a number of "independent" deliverables displaying broken signature
links, which makes us look bad.

This adds a flag (skipped-sig) that can be set for independent
deliverables that did not have any signature generated (pre-Ocata), and

commit_message:
Skip sig links if the skipped-sig flag is set

In releases.o.o we display signature links for all deliverables,
if the series is > Ocata or independent. Since some "independent"
deliverables predate the signature generation tooling, that results
in a number of "independent" deliverables displaying broken signature
links, which makes us look bad.

This adds a flag (skipped-sig) that can be set for independent
deliverables that did not have any signature generated (pre-Ocata), and
skips the signature link display if the flag is set.

As a practical example, this fixes broken links for PBR<2. Tony signed
up to automatically generate the others.

Change-Id: I44a49e3f08010a85c64673d2292528139eabcc99

subject: Add release-approval pipeline
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-05 15:50:53.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/pipelines.yaml', 'tools/normalize_acl.py', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/releases.config'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/7e896b57eb6e6f1be97df0841c897765d8c1f11d', 'message': 'Add release-approval pipeline

Define a release-approval pipeline to run the check-release-approval
job on every comment added to a release request, and set a
PTL-Approved label accordingly.

This may be considered a bit resource-intensive, however the
check-release-approval job is a fast python script that runs on
the executor, and only release requests shall go in this pipeline.
If this generates too much load, we could configure it to only run
when the comment posted contains a magic "signoff" keyword.

Another concern is that jobs other than check-release-approval would
be added to this pipeline. There does not seem to be a way in Zuul to
limit a pipeline to a specific job name or project.

Change-Id: Ieab04a4d6c02b216a59c12ec8599e7d91f4fffb1
'}]
commit_message:
Add release-approval pipeline

Define a release-approval pipeline to run the check-release-approval
job on every comment added to a release request, and set a
PTL-Approved label accordingly.

This may be considered a bit resource-intensive, however the
check-release-approval job is a fast python script that runs on
the executor, and only release requests shall go in this pipeline.
If this generates too much load, we could configure it to only run
when the comment posted contains a magic "signoff" keyword.

Another concern is that jobs other than check-release-approval would
be added to this pipeline. There does not seem to be a way in Zuul to
limit a pipeline to a specific job name or project.

Change-Id: Ieab04a4d6c02b216a59c12ec8599e7d91f4fffb1

added_lines: from charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.audits.openstack_security_guide import ( _config_ini as config_ini ) def validate_ovs_use_veth(*args, **kwargs): """Validate OVS use veth setting for dhcp agents The ovs_use_veth setting is considered immutable as it will break existing deployments. Historically, we set ovs_use_veth=True in dhcp_agent.ini. It turns out this is no longer necessary. Ideally, all new deployments would have this set to False. This function validates that the config value does not conflict with previously deployed settings in dhcp_agent.ini. See LP Bug#1831935 for details. :returns: Status state and message :rtype: Union[(None, None), (string, string)] """ existing_ovs_use_veth = ( DHCPAgentContext.get_existing_ovs_use_veth()) config_ovs_use_veth = DHCPAgentContext.parse_ovs_use_veth() # Check settings are set and not None if existing_ovs_use_veth is not None and config_ovs_use_veth is not None: # Check for mismatch between existing config ini and juju config if existing_ovs_use_veth != config_ovs_use_veth: # Stop the line to avoid breakage msg = ( "The existing setting for dhcp_agent.ini ovs_use_veth, {}, " "does not match the juju config setting, {}. This may lead to " "VMs being unable to receive a DHCP IP. Either change the " "juju config setting or dhcp agents may need to be recreated." .format(existing_ovs_use_veth, config_ovs_use_veth)) log(msg, ERROR) return ( "blocked", "Mismatched existing and configured ovs-use-veth. See log.") # Everything is OK return None, None class DHCPAgentContext(OSContextGenerator): def __call__(self): """Return the DHCPAGentContext. Return all DHCP Agent INI related configuration. ovs unit is attached to (as a subordinate) and the 'dns_domain' from the neutron-plugin-api relations (if one is set). :returns: Dictionary context :rtype: Dict """ ctxt = {} dnsmasq_flags = config('dnsmasq-flags') if dnsmasq_flags: ctxt['dnsmasq_flags'] = config_flags_parser(dnsmasq_flags) ctxt['dns_servers'] = config('dns-servers') neutron_api_settings = NeutronAPIContext()() ctxt['debug'] = config('debug') ctxt['instance_mtu'] = config('instance-mtu') ctxt['ovs_use_veth'] = self.get_ovs_use_veth() ctxt['enable_metadata_network'] = config('enable-metadata-network') ctxt['enable_isolated_metadata'] = config('enable-isolated-metadata') if neutron_api_settings.get('dns_domain'): ctxt['dns_domain'] = neutron_api_settings.get('dns_domain') # Override user supplied config for these plugins as these settings are # mandatory if config('plugin') in ['nvp', 'nsx', 'n1kv']: ctxt['enable_metadata_network'] = True ctxt['enable_isolated_metadata'] = True return ctxt @staticmethod def get_existing_ovs_use_veth(): """Return existing ovs_use_veth setting from dhcp_agent.ini. :returns: Boolean value of existing ovs_use_veth setting or None :rtype: Optional[Bool] """ DHCP_AGENT_INI = "/etc/neutron/dhcp_agent.ini" existing_ovs_use_veth = None # If there is a dhcp_agent.ini file read the current setting if os.path.isfile(DHCP_AGENT_INI): # config_ini does the right thing and returns None if the setting is # commented. existing_ovs_use_veth = ( config_ini(DHCP_AGENT_INI)["DEFAULT"].get("ovs_use_veth")) # Convert to Bool if necessary if isinstance(existing_ovs_use_veth, six.string_types): return bool_from_string(existing_ovs_use_veth) return existing_ovs_use_veth @staticmethod def parse_ovs_use_veth(): """Parse the ovs-use-veth config setting. Parse the string config setting for ovs-use-veth and return a boolean or None. bool_from_string will raise a ValueError if the string is not falsy or truthy. :raises: ValueError for invalid input :returns: Boolean value of ovs-use-veth or None :rtype: Optional[Bool] """ _config = config("ovs-use-veth") # An unset parameter returns None. Just in case we will also check for # an empty string: "". Ironically, (the problem we are trying to avoid) # "False" returns True and "" returns False. if _config is None or not _config: # Return None return # bool_from_string handles many variations of true and false strings # as well as upper and lowercases including: # ['y', 'yes', 'true', 't', 'on', 'n', 'no', 'false', 'f', 'off'] return bool_from_string(_config) def get_ovs_use_veth(self): """Return correct ovs_use_veth setting for use in dhcp_agent.ini. Get the right value from config or existing dhcp_agent.ini file. Existing has precedence. Attempt to default to "False" without disrupting existing deployments. Handle existing deployments and upgrades safely. See LP Bug#1831935 :returns: Value to use for ovs_use_veth setting :rtype: Bool """ _existing = self.get_existing_ovs_use_veth() if _existing is not None: return _existing _config = self.parse_ovs_use_veth() if _config is None: # New better default return False else: return _config

commit_message:
Release oslo.config 8.0.0

This version officially drop the python 2 support so we release a major
version of oslo.config to inform user that we break
the backward compatibility.

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
-
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I487af3628b0dc557d093e241d68d70ceee309ebd

commit_message:
Release oslo.cache 2.0.0

This version officially drop the python 2 support so we release a major
version of oslo.cache to inform user that we break
the backward compatibility.

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
-
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ie05bf00fc0b3721eb5c80b1d9bd8c2689786f17f

Handle existing deployments and upgrades safely. See LP Bug#1831935 :returns: Value to use for ovs_use_veth setting :rtype: Bool """ _existing = self.get_existing_ovs_use_veth() if _existing is not None: return _existing _config = self.parse_ovs_use_veth() if _config is None: # New better default return False else: return _config

added_lines: from charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.audits.openstack_security_guide import ( _config_ini as config_ini ) def validate_ovs_use_veth(*args, **kwargs): """Validate OVS use veth setting for dhcp agents The ovs_use_veth setting is considered immutable as it will break existing deployments. Historically, we set ovs_use_veth=True in dhcp_agent.ini. It turns out this is no longer necessary. Ideally, all new deployments would have this set to False. This function validates that the config value does not conflict with previously deployed settings in dhcp_agent.ini. See LP Bug#1831935 for details. :returns: Status state and message :rtype: Union[(None, None), (string, string)] """ existing_ovs_use_veth = ( DHCPAgentContext.get_existing_ovs_use_veth()) config_ovs_use_veth = DHCPAgentContext.parse_ovs_use_veth() # Check settings are set and not None if existing_ovs_use_veth is not None and config_ovs_use_veth is not None: # Check for mismatch between existing config ini and juju config if existing_ovs_use_veth != config_ovs_use_veth: # Stop the line to avoid breakage msg = ( "The existing setting for dhcp_agent.ini ovs_use_veth, {}, " "does not match the juju config setting, {}. This may lead to " "VMs being unable to receive a DHCP IP. Either change the " "juju config setting or dhcp agents may need to be recreated." .format(existing_ovs_use_veth, config_ovs_use_veth)) log(msg, ERROR) return ( "blocked", "Mismatched existing and configured ovs-use-veth. See log.") # Everything is OK return None, None class DHCPAgentContext(OSContextGenerator): def __call__(self): """Return the DHCPAGentContext. Return all DHCP Agent INI related configuration. ovs unit is attached to (as a subordinate) and the 'dns_domain' from the neutron-plugin-api relations (if one is set). :returns: Dictionary context :rtype: Dict """ ctxt = {} dnsmasq_flags = config('dnsmasq-flags') if dnsmasq_flags: ctxt['dnsmasq_flags'] = config_flags_parser(dnsmasq_flags) ctxt['dns_servers'] = config('dns-servers') neutron_api_settings = NeutronAPIContext()() ctxt['debug'] = config('debug') ctxt['instance_mtu'] = config('instance-mtu') ctxt['ovs_use_veth'] = self.get_ovs_use_veth() ctxt['enable_metadata_network'] = config('enable-metadata-network') ctxt['enable_isolated_metadata'] = config('enable-isolated-metadata') if neutron_api_settings.get('dns_domain'): ctxt['dns_domain'] = neutron_api_settings.get('dns_domain') # Override user supplied config for these plugins as these settings are # mandatory if config('plugin') in ['nvp', 'nsx', 'n1kv']: ctxt['enable_metadata_network'] = True ctxt['enable_isolated_metadata'] = True return ctxt @staticmethod def get_existing_ovs_use_veth(): """Return existing ovs_use_veth setting from dhcp_agent.ini. :returns: Boolean value of existing ovs_use_veth setting or None :rtype: Optional[Bool] """ DHCP_AGENT_INI = "/etc/neutron/dhcp_agent.ini" existing_ovs_use_veth = None # If there is a dhcp_agent.ini file read the current setting if os.path.isfile(DHCP_AGENT_INI): # config_ini does the right thing and returns None if the setting is # commented. existing_ovs_use_veth = ( config_ini(DHCP_AGENT_INI)["DEFAULT"].get("ovs_use_veth")) # Convert to Bool if necessary if isinstance(existing_ovs_use_veth, six.string_types): return bool_from_string(existing_ovs_use_veth) return existing_ovs_use_veth @staticmethod def parse_ovs_use_veth(): """Parse the ovs-use-veth config setting. Parse the string config setting for ovs-use-veth and return a boolean or None. bool_from_string will raise a ValueError if the string is not falsy or truthy. :raises: ValueError for invalid input :returns: Boolean value of ovs-use-veth or None :rtype: Optional[Bool] """ _config = config("ovs-use-veth") # An unset parameter returns None. Just in case we will also check for # an empty string: "". Ironically, (the problem we are trying to avoid) # "False" returns True and "" returns False. if _config is None or not _config: # Return None return # bool_from_string handles many variations of true and false strings # as well as upper and lowercases including: # ['y', 'yes', 'true', 't', 'on', 'n', 'no', 'false', 'f', 'off'] return bool_from_string(_config) def get_ovs_use_veth(self): """Return correct ovs_use_veth setting for use in dhcp_agent.ini. Get the right value from config or existing dhcp_agent.ini file. Existing has precedence. Attempt to default to "False" without disrupting existing deployments. Handle existing deployments and upgrades safely. See LP Bug#1831935 :returns: Value to use for ovs_use_veth setting :rtype: Bool """ _existing = self.get_existing_ovs_use_veth() if _existing is not None: return _existing _config = self.parse_ovs_use_veth() if _config is None: # New better default return False else: return _config

Charmhelper sync for 20.02

Also remove disco from metadata and tests

Change-Id: I932a09f99df19a9916450060b67f0e43085b0b02
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-cinder-ceph refs/changes/38/705738/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from charmhelpers.contrib.openstack.audits.openstack_security_guide import ( _config_ini as config_ini ) def validate_ovs_use_veth(*args, **kwargs): """Validate OVS use veth setting for dhcp agents The ovs_use_veth setting is considered immutable as it will break existing deployments. This function validates that the config value does not conflict with previously deployed settings in dhcp_agent.ini. See LP Bug#1831935 for details. :returns: Status state and message :rtype: Union[(None, None), (string, string)] """ existing_ovs_use_veth = ( DHCPAgentContext.get_existing_ovs_use_veth()) config_ovs_use_veth = DHCPAgentContext.parse_ovs_use_veth() # Check settings are set and not None if existing_ovs_use_veth is not None and config_ovs_use_veth is not None: # Check for mismatch between existing config ini and juju config if existing_ovs_use_veth != config_ovs_use_veth: # Stop the line to avoid breakage msg = ( "The existing setting for dhcp_agent.ini ovs_use_veth, {}, " "does not match the juju config setting, {}. This may lead to " "VMs being unable to receive a DHCP IP. Either change the " "juju config setting or dhcp agents may need to be recreated." .format(existing_ovs_use_veth, config_ovs_use_veth)) log(msg, ERROR) return ( "blocked", "Mismatched existing and configured ovs-use-veth. See log.") # Everything is OK return None, None class DHCPAgentContext(OSContextGenerator): def __call__(self): """Return the DHCPAGentContext. Return all DHCP Agent INI related configuration. ovs unit is attached to (as a subordinate) and the 'dns_domain' from the neutron-plugin-api relations (if one is set). :returns: Dictionary context :rtype: Dict """ ctxt = {} dnsmasq_flags = config('dnsmasq-flags') if dnsmasq_flags: ctxt['dnsmasq_flags'] = config_flags_parser(dnsmasq_flags) ctxt['dns_servers'] = config('dns-servers') neutron_api_settings = NeutronAPIContext()() ctxt['debug'] = config('debug') ctxt['instance_mtu'] = config('instance-mtu') ctxt['ovs_use_veth'] = self.get_ovs_use_veth() ctxt['enable_metadata_network'] = config('enable-metadata-network') ctxt['enable_isolated_metadata'] = config('enable-isolated-metadata') if neutron_api_settings.get('dns_domain'): ctxt['dns_domain'] = neutron_api_settings.get('dns_domain') # Override user supplied config for these plugins as these settings are # mandatory if config('plugin') in ['nvp', 'nsx', 'n1kv']: ctxt['enable_metadata_network'] = True ctxt['enable_isolated_metadata'] = True return ctxt @staticmethod def get_existing_ovs_use_veth(): """Return existing ovs_use_veth setting from dhcp_agent.ini. :returns: Boolean value of existing ovs_use_veth setting or None :rtype: Optional[Bool] """ DHCP_AGENT_INI = "/etc/neutron/dhcp_agent.ini" existing_ovs_use_veth = None # If there is a dhcp_agent.ini file read the current setting if os.path.isfile(DHCP_AGENT_INI): # config_ini does the right thing and returns None if the setting is # commented. existing_ovs_use_veth = ( config_ini(DHCP_AGENT_INI)["DEFAULT"].get("ovs_use_veth")) # Convert to Bool if necessary if isinstance(existing_ovs_use_veth, six.string_types): return bool_from_string(existing_ovs_use_veth) return existing_ovs_use_veth @staticmethod def parse_ovs_use_veth(): """Parse the ovs-use-veth config setting. Parse the string config setting for ovs-use-veth and return a boolean or None. bool_from_string will raise a ValueError if the string is not falsy or truthy. :raises: ValueError for invalid input :returns: Boolean value of ovs-use-veth or None :rtype: Optional[Bool] """ _config = config("ovs-use-veth") # An unset parameter returns None. Just in case we will also check for # an empty string: "". Ironically, (the problem we are trying to avoid) # "False" returns True and "" returns False. if _config is None or not _config: # Return None return # bool_from_string handles many variations of true and false strings # as well as upper and lowercases including: # ['y', 'yes', 'true', 't', 'on', 'n', 'no', 'false', 'f', 'off'] return bool_from_string(_config) def get_ovs_use_veth(self): """Return correct ovs_use_veth setting for use in dhcp_agent.ini. Get the right value from config or existing dhcp_agent.ini file. Existing has precedence. Attempt to default to "False" without disrupting existing deployments. Handle existing deployments and upgrades safely. See LP Bug#1831935 :returns: Value to use for ovs_use_veth setting :rtype: Bool """ _existing = self.get_existing_ovs_use_veth() if _existing is not None: return _existing _config = self.parse_ovs_use_veth() if _config is None: # New better default return False else: return _config

commit_message:
tests: Get RoleData correctly

In Ie543782569de14d56bc41740611f7512e8357a22 a new entry was added
into the fake stack, but the indexes for any test accessing the
FAKE_STACK were not changed, effectively breaking several tests
silently.

This patch removes the direct referencing of indexes in FAKE_STACK
and uses the config utilities to get the data correctly. It also
corrects the reference to the constant UPGRADE_STEPS_MAX which no
longer exists thanks to Ie03084bb599b7b06aeeb321d2a7938a908487788

We also add mock_assert_called to several of the tests to ensure
that if the fake_role list is empty, the test will fail.

Change-Id: I08757ab389f35de52814fba48722e9325e50ab21

revisions:

Commit introduces some bug fixes and makes minor tweaks to allow
NUMALiveMigrationTest to work in an environment deployed via TripleO.
Changes include updating config.py group name for whitebox_database to
match how it's called in test_cpu_pinning.py.  Also TripleO does not
setup mysql to listen on the same host ip as its SSH ip, so port 3306
should appened to SSHTunnelForwarder when accessing the controller(s).
Undercloud is also not setup to resolve compute/controller hostnames so
it fails setup a ServiceManager prior to doing live migration in test
test_cpu_pinning, updated to pass the host's IP instead.

commit_message:
Updates to run NUMALiveMigrationTest in tripleO

For downstream TripleO deployments, Undercloud is not setup to resolve
the IP addresses for compute/controller hostnames. To allow for an SSH
connection from the Undercloud to Overcloud databases,
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning was updated with a new call to
get_hypervisor_ip(). When setting up the ServiceManager() it will now
attempt to use the compute's IP address instead of the hostname. If no
IP information is found in [whitebox]/hypervisors, which is standard in
most devstack deployments, the hostname is utilized instead.  This is
the only instance where ServiceManager() utilized a hostname when
creating the service, all other ServiceManager() creations in
test_cpu_pinning.py use IP so no additional changes are necessary.

The current workaround for Nova bug 1836945 was only in place in
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_cpu_pinning, added the same workaround to
NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_emulator_threads.

Iterator pagecounts in NUMALiveMigrationTest.test_hugepages was
exhausted via a skipException check before it could be used to calculate
the minimum free huge pages on a host. Iterator was 'reset' by creating
a new iterator of same var name.

Change-Id: I26855789d2da302c7356a71c42515ec4329cedd5

commit_message:
CentOS 8: Fix CentOS 7 publisher tag

Currently we use CentOS 8 nodepool images for all CI build jobs. This
means we can't use the ansible_distribution_major_version fact to detect
whether we are building CentOS 7 or 8 images. Due to this, all CentOS
images (including CentOS 7) are currently published with a
'master-centos8' tag.

This change fixes the issue by using the base_tag variable which is
defined for CentOS 8 build jobs.

Change-Id: I29b7b8ee742120107a11bd419ac58ab5c09b0b75
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/71/705971/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% set tag_suffix = '-centos8' if ansible_distribution | lower == 'centos' and base_tag | default == 8 else '' %}
deleted_lines: {% set tag_suffix = '-centos8' if ansible_distribution | lower == 'centos' and ansible_distribution_major_version == '8' else '' %}

commit_message:
Remove namespace isolation support

NetworkPolicy can replicate what namespace isolation does (and much
more), so we are removing the code that is not needed

Change-Id: Ib79c21cb92c522744658a204001383b6c0e98846

commit_message:
Use Tempest v23.0.0 for Rocky testing instead of master

Tempest master is dropping the py3.5 support[1] and last
tag work well with py3.5 is 23.0.0.

Stable/rocky jobs use xenail node which has py3.5 version.

Related--Bug: 1861308
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704840/

Change-Id: Idc51a898944b087c7a5982c3451b88eeb1af6e6a

commit_message:
Force arp_responder to True when DVR and tunneling enabled

After [1] and [2], the ARP responder needs to be enabled
if DVR and tunneling are enabled or ARP will not work. If
it is False we will log a message and force it to True.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/651905/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/653883/

Change-Id: I934062c970effe5194056b0786f84f3246850701
Related-bug: #1774459
(cherry picked from commit ea85e39660abaa224c159c42214fdb7042302bea)

commit_message:
Add voting k2k tests

With the addition of K2K-specific tests in the tempest plugin and a
config toggle in the plugin to disable use of the external IdP, we can
safely add a voting federation job. This also fixes the devstack plugin
to install the xmlsec1 tool which is needed for K2K.

Change-Id: I9dc634e073657ff337751ec67363a57bd10e20d4
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/689222
(cherry picked from commit fb0be8e59917b5b637926d9526a64676af07ebf0)

commit_message:
Reset timeout exception in DietTestCase when retrying

In case of fixtures.TimeoutException, DietTestCase retries the
execution of the test case (introduced in [1]). But the timeout
fixture was not reset. This can lead to a general execution timeout
if a test do not exit in a proper time.

[1] If865c4683645f9bd11f5e1b528bade0547505bfd

Related-Bug: #1843478
Partial-Bug: #1848944
Change-Id: Ib6ef58b5259ea4bf151e866f6244ff87b195b139
(cherry picked from commit 4f59db2fab33e39f3d101885263e5f6483ad2b94)

deleted_lines: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() as ctxt: if idx < TESTCASE_RETRIES: msg = ('"fixtures.TimeoutException" during test case ' 'execution no %s; test case re-executed' % idx) self.addDetail('DietTestCase', msg) ctxt.reraise = False

commit_message:
Fix error handling on add/remove router iface calls

Ib1f880f75e511faaf8c798da22b9ca54dd441166 was manually processing call
results to raise SDKException. Instead of that
exception.raise_from_response() should be used to make sure a correct
exception class is thrown (e.g. NotFoundException on 404 results) and
this commit fixes this.

Change-Id: I76b33e6c870971cdf50938d1328445702c83b64a
Story: #2006679
Task: #38575

commit_message:
nova-libvirt: add UEFI packages to support UEFI instances

Fix inability to run UEFI-based images/instances by installing UEFI
packages also in nova-libvirt image which is not based on nova-base.

Includes support for C8.
Backport below Train w/o C8.

Closes-Bug: #1814552
Co-authored-by: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>
Co-authored-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1d5cd3d9af98444acac5bedd7daeaa6c6673dcd6
(cherry picked from commit 15b68c15c1dd0c2df1cc49b550f2fa03a4c65e8e)

commit_message:
Complete "Drop python2 support" goal

We stopped testing python2, but there are more things to be cleanup.

- Remove python2 entries from setup.cfg
- Add releasenotes
- remove universal wheel since this is only python 3 now

Change-Id: Ie2bbb4d34b8411939ad5cfd750fc76c933779542

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Tricircle is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ia1352479bf3148ca68c432acf30cd55290d8bd3e

subject: Fix the barbicanclient installation not from source
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-10 13:21:12.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/barbican', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/3d23804a6f78f881ac5526bc31e2a7c61b174516', 'message': 'Fix the barbicanclient installation not from source

- follow the standard installation pattern for barbicanclient:
  only clones if it is installed from source. This way it is
  possible to install and test barbicanclient from pip
  by default, additional jobs can simply add it
  to required-projects;
- define the repository metadata using the GIT* arrays.
  They are also defined by stackrc, but they should be probably
  removed from there;
- remove the useless call of configure_barbicanclient (the same
  steps are already performed by install_barbicanclient).
  Going forward, configure_barbicanclient can be removed

Change-Id: Iea1cd3f82c3b38f03f91b0191846e1ddbbfb1d6c
(cherry picked from commit 646a0360b97d09146cb3b9a4d9bef927d074c239)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the barbicanclient installation not from source

- follow the standard installation pattern for barbicanclient:
  only clones if it is installed from source. This way it is
  possible to install and test barbicanclient from pip
  by default, additional jobs can simply add it
  to required-projects;
- define the repository metadata using the GIT* arrays.
  They are also defined by stackrc, but they should be probably
  removed from there;
- remove the useless call of configure_barbicanclient (the same
  steps are already performed by install_barbicanclient).
  Going forward, configure_barbicanclient can be removed

Change-Id: Iea1cd3f82c3b38f03f91b0191846e1ddbbfb1d6c
(cherry picked from commit 646a0360b97d09146cb3b9a4d9bef927d074c239)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/36/698236/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # python barbican client library GITREPO["python-barbicanclient"]=${BARBICANCLIENT_REPO:-${GIT_BASE}/openstack/python-barbicanclient.git} GITBRANCH["python-barbicanclient"]=${BARBICANCLIENT_BRANCH:-$TARGET_BRANCH} GITDIR["python-barbicanclient"]=$DEST/python-barbicanclient

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-12 12:22:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/cfbb840ae3a7ee40607a5ac7ed43330815490d19', 'message': "Restart keystone container after fernet bootstrap

There are cases when a multinode deployment ends up in unusable
keystone public wsgi on some nodes.

The root cause is that keystone public wsgi doesn't find fernet
keys on startup - and then persists on sending 500 errors to any
requests.

Change-Id: I63709c2e3f6a893db82a05640da78f492bf8440f
Closes-Bug: #1846789
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/698702

"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2019-12-12 16:32:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/cbf01ac2e9dde641989432481066a3bc8c389048', 'message': "Initialize fernet keys before starting keystone container

There are cases when a multinode deployment ends up in unusable
keystone public wsgi on some nodes.

The root cause is that keystone public wsgi doesn't find fernet
keys on startup - and then persists on sending 500 errors to any
requests - due to a race condition between
fernet_setup/fernet-push.sh and keystone startup.

Change-Id: I63709c2e3f6a893db82a05640da78f492bf8440f
Closes-Bug: #1846789

commit_message:
Fix keystone fernet bootstrap

There are cases when a multinode deployment ends up in unusable
keystone public wsgi on some nodes.

The root cause is that keystone public wsgi doesn't find fernet
keys on startup - and then persists on sending 500 errors to any
requests - due to a race condition between
fernet_setup/fernet-push.sh and keystone startup.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/703742/
Change-Id: I63709c2e3f6a893db82a05640da78f492bf8440f
Closes-Bug: #1846789

commit_message:
Convert network policy non-voting job to use Ceph

This patchset changes the Zuul network policy job to use Ceph
instead of NFS file system, and deploys Cinder as well, so that
the policies for all Openstack services can be deployed and tested
in one job.

Change-Id: I40d7bbeb9d131106b6f2d667ea809d429ad1a6be

commit_message:
Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2.
requirements.txt is updated accordingly.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
Change-Id: Ie0015353ec57b2daa9ff626961c142289ac18069

Change is required to properly implement logic in fernet-node-sync.sh on
kolla-ansible side - to add a check if fernet key store is populated with
required number of tokens.

added_lines: Swift Global Replication ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ As of the 20.02 charm release, with OpenStack Newton or later, support for a global cluster in Swift is available as a tech preview. Please see the `Swift global cluster appendix`_ in the charm deployment guide for more information on enabling the feature. .. warning :: If a fork of the Swift charms is in use which has this feature enabled then a charm upgrade will almost certainly cause issues. This is due to changes in charm config options and the way the swift init scripts are configured. .. _Swift global cluster appendix: https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/charm-deployment-guide/latest/app-swift-gc.html

commit_message:
Fix the barbicanclient installation not from source

- follow the standard installation pattern for barbicanclient:
  only clones if it is installed from source. This way it is
  possible to install and test barbicanclient from pip
  by default, additional jobs can simply add it
  to required-projects;
- define the repository metadata using the GIT* arrays.
  They are also defined by stackrc, but they should be probably
  removed from there;
- remove the useless call of configure_barbicanclient (the same
  steps are already performed by install_barbicanclient).
  Going forward, configure_barbicanclient can be removed

Change-Id: Iea1cd3f82c3b38f03f91b0191846e1ddbbfb1d6c

commit_message:
Handle saving too big messages in last_error field

If the deployment using ansible deploy interface fails, the error
returned from ansible might be quite substantial. In some cases it
can be more than 64KiB, which is the limit of the last_error field
in the nodes table (for most database backends). As the deployment
error is saved into database as-is, there is a possibility of
failure to save this info in the database. This change fixes this
issue by saving "see the logs" message into the last_error field.

Story: 2007266
Task: 38659

Change-Id: I5f7003efd5108264e54d6e45aabf680bb86a04ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/95/705995/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | If the deployment using ansible deploy interface fails, the error returned from ansible might be quite substantial. In some cases it can be more than 64KiB, which is the limit of the `last_error` field in the nodes table (for most database backends). As the deployment error is saved into the database as-is, there was a possibility of failure to save this info in the database. This release fixes this issue by saving "see the logs" message into the `last_error` field.

commit_message:
s/assertItemsEqual/assertCountEqual/g

assertItemsEqual was renamed to assertCountEqual in Python 3, and the
testsuite is failing now - rename it.
See also https://six.readthedocs.io/#six.assertCountEqual

This unbreaks the testsuite.

Change-Id: I3cce625c3cad6303f99198ba1c91f59f6f5add41

commit_message:
Set the delayed call "key" field to the right value

* The field "key" of the DelayedCall class must be set to the right
  value. It allows to significantly optimize performance of workflows
  with "join" tasks. However, it was broken during the refactoring
  in the summer of 2019. This patch fixes it.
* Added another profiler trace decorator.

Closes-Bug: #1861988
Change-Id: I247b674d8a358795871cfa87bcdf29f4857ca2d8

commit_message:
Update the lb_id on an amp earlier if we know it

When we create amphora for specific loadbalancer it would be
good to get info about mapping pair loadbalancer-amphora as
soon as possible.

For example, if admin needs to debug connectivity issues with amphora
VMs - loadbalancer_id won't be set until AmphoraComputeConnectivityWait
task succeeds (which is never for such case) so they have to go to worker
logs to understand which amphora is related to a currently creating
loadbalancer.

Co-Authored-By: Ann Taraday <akamyshnikova@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I865445af34bc63b90d965ef5e2c8f9f49aa9c2f3

subject: Ensure the facter cache has at most one writer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-05 13:03:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/65088c986cba2867c46b4edc2945c735ab8b8a90', 'message': "Ensure the facter cache has at most one writer

If the host's facter pre-cache step fails, the container-puppet
executions will fail with some other error around facts. If we want to
skip the cache, then we need to not mount the folder as read-only as
that has other effects. Neither can we mount it as RW because
of the multiple container puppet config processes can access it
simultaneously.

To solve that issue, make sure the facter cache has at most writer
for its lower overlayfs layer. While the upper layer can take only
ephemeral updates from another container puppet config processes,
if any has to fix the cache or whatnot.

To achieve that behavior, check if the facter cache path appears
to be already mounted on the host. If it is use the overlay mode (:O)
instead.

This solution only works for podman and not docker.

Change-Id: I2a0362418ce59cfeea460458ac8778a438b14ee9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-02-05 13:04:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/af9a96758cbbf6754f2453f57d586b9432cfc341', 'message': "Ensure the facter cache has at most one writer

If the host's facter pre-cache step fails, the container-puppet
executions will fail with some other error around facts. If we want to
skip the cache, then we need to not mount the folder as read-only as
that has other effects. Neither can we mount it as RW because
of the multiple container puppet config processes can access it
simultaneously.

To solve that issue, make sure the facter cache has at most writer
for its lower overlayfs layer. While the upper layer can take only
ephemeral updates from another container puppet config processes,
if any has to fix the cache or whatnot.

To achieve that behavior, check if the facter cache path appears
to be already mounted on the host. If it is use the overlay mode (:O)
instead.

This solution only works for podman >1.4 and not docker.

Closes-bug: #1861917

Change-Id: I2a0362418ce59cfeea460458ac8778a438b14ee9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2020-02-05 13:05:36.000000000', 'files': ['common/container-puppet.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/7fca04c5980107c904aacddc4f755fc91046ea80', 'message': "Ensure the facter cache has at most one writer

If the host's facter pre-cache step fails, the container-puppet
executions will fail with some other error around facts. If we want to
skip the cache, then we need to not mount the folder as read-only as
that has other effects. Neither can we mount it as RW because
of the multiple container puppet config processes can access it
simultaneously.

To solve that issue, make sure the facter cache has no more than a
single writer for its lower overlayfs layer. While the upper layer can
take only ephemeral updates from another container puppet config
processes, if any has to fix the cache or whatnot.

To achieve that behavior, check if the facter cache path appears
to be already mounted on the host. If it is use the overlay mode (:O)
instead.

This solution only works for podman >1.4 and not docker.

Closes-bug: #1861917

Change-Id: I2a0362418ce59cfeea460458ac8778a438b14ee9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure the facter cache has at most one writer

If the host's facter pre-cache step fails, the container-puppet
executions will fail with some other error around facts. If we want to
skip the cache, then we need to not mount the folder as read-only as
that has other effects. Neither can we mount it as RW because
of the multiple container puppet config processes can access it
simultaneously.

To solve that issue, make sure the facter cache has no more than a
single writer for its lower overlayfs layer. While the upper layer can
take only ephemeral updates from another container puppet config
processes, if any has to fix the cache or whatnot.

To achieve that behavior, check if the facter cache path appears
to be already mounted on the host. If it is use the overlay mode (:O)
instead.

This solution only works for podman >1.4 and not docker.

Closes-bug: #1861917

Change-Id: I2a0362418ce59cfeea460458ac8778a438b14ee9
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/54/705954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Evaluate the bind-mount mode for the facter cache # Check if it has any mounts on the host _, _, retval = local_subprocess_call(cmd='findmnt %s' % FACTER_CACHE) if retval != 0: facter_mount_mode = 'O' # all can only write to upper overlayfs else: facter_mount_mode = 'rw' # at most one can write to the lower fs '%s:/etc/puppetlabs/facter/facter.conf:%s' % ( FACTER_CACHE, facter_mount_mode ), FACTER_CACHE='/var/lib/container-puppet/puppetlabs/facter.conf'

commit_message:
Move environment to a var fo easier debugging

If we configure the environment vars as an internal variable it allows
us to print them out with the command when debugging is enabled.

Change-Id: Ida7b9f1a4c3b27c7f702bf47d5992646eb34430c

commit_message:
Fix py3 gate

Netaddr library is supported in py2 and py3. We should be using it
instead of relying on ipaddress, which is only supported in py3.

Co-Authored-By: Michał Dulko <mdulko@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I93ee6343a66de1adcaca800e0614da72a4df60d9

These devices can no longer be disabled from the bios settings
so the simplest course of action seems to be that we should
handle the existence of a read-only device.

In the event of secure erase, this is treated as a hard failure

commit_message:
Skip read-only devices with metadata erase

HPE "Virtual Install Devices" appear as read-only block
devices, and may... or may not be visible depending on the
bios configuration state.

These devices can no longer be disabled from the bios settings
so the simplest course of action seems to be that we should
handle the existence of a read-only device.

In the event of secure erase, this is treated as a hard failure
case and a driver_internal_info flag has been added to enable
a future bypass method for knowledgable operators.

Backport note: the unit tests have been modified to account for Python 2

Conflicts:
	ironic_python_agent/hardware.py
	ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_hardware.py

Change-Id: Ief8b360d11e654d8fae3a04a2a9f8d474a06e167
Story: 2007229
Task: 38502
(cherry picked from commit cd7b2693f873bde72706f8b6ab8c1f21e68f0fd1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/62/705062/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue where metadata erasure cleaning would fail on devices that are read-only at the hardware level. Typically these are virtual devices being offered to the operating system for purposes like OS self-installation. In the case of full device erasure, this is explicitly raised as a hard failure requiring operator intervention.

commit_message:
Fix bug: AttributeError arises while sorting with standard attributes

Common neutron resource(e.g, Port) consists of:
1. Resource Attributes, e.g: Port.mac_address, etc.
2. Standard Attributes, e.g: created_at, and are shared among all
   neutron resources.
The `sort` opt only supports limited attributes. We need to filter
attributes that are defined with `is_sort_key=True` and it's preferred
to explicitly warn CLI & API users of illegal sort keys rather than
just accept without check, pass forward and then hit a internal error
which's quite confusing.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660097/
Change-Id: I8d206f909b09f1279dfcdc25c39989a67bff93d5
Closes-Bug: #1659175
(cherry picked from commit 335ac4e2d95c164d66a3b09d9fd08e9c563edfc2)

subject: Fix resource schemas and releated `get_sorts` test cases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-01-31 17:30:08.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/extensions/securitygroup.py', 'neutron/extensions/segment.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_network_segment_range.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/874ffe0d6b362b19a22fdff1bbbb194687b9c1b8', 'message': "Fix resource schemas and releated `get_sorts` test cases

When I'm trying to introduce a central sort-keys validation within
patch [1] to `get_sorts` method in `neutron.api.api_common` module,
I get blocked by some resource schemas and test cases. After reading
neutron API docs and some inspection, I believe there exists uses of
improper sort keys in test cases and some resource schemes need to
keep aligned with offical documents.

* Schemas of resource SecurityGroups/SG Rules/Segments don't provide
`is_sort_key` flag for their sort key properties claimed in offical
docs as neutron-lib does. See [2] for more details.

* Test cases of resource NetworkSegmentRange use unsupported sort keys,
e.g: physical_network. Replace it with `name` property. See [2] for more
details.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/653903/
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html

Change-Id: I45a51736e4075e3dbc16827486869d70b659622d
(cherry picked from commit ed3f1087fa354a91721d3046ce134e18c86f22b3)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix resource schemas and releated `get_sorts` test cases

When I'm trying to introduce a central sort-keys validation within
patch [1] to `get_sorts` method in `neutron.api.api_common` module,
I get blocked by some resource schemas and test cases. After reading
neutron API docs and some inspection, I believe there exists uses of
improper sort keys in test cases and some resource schemes need to
keep aligned with offical documents.

* Schemas of resource SecurityGroups/SG Rules/Segments don't provide
`is_sort_key` flag for their sort key properties claimed in offical
docs as neutron-lib does. See [2] for more details.

* Test cases of resource NetworkSegmentRange use unsupported sort keys,
e.g: physical_network. Replace it with `name` property. See [2] for more
details.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/653903/
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html

Change-Id: I45a51736e4075e3dbc16827486869d70b659622d
(cherry picked from commit ed3f1087fa354a91721d3046ce134e18c86f22b3)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Karbor is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/
Change-Id: Id923a1e18a1ba2439eda11a88abab64a3b32cab1

commit_message:
Change fetch_fernet_tokens.py behaviour to check for minimum number of tokens

Change is required to properly implement logic in fernet-node-sync.sh on
kolla-ansible side - to add a check if fernet key store is populated with
required number of tokens.

Change-Id: I51ed61e34a1dd79532b4528e56a9cd9011d46e6d
Related-Bug: #1846789

commit_message:
Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2.
requirements.txt is updated accordingly.
For more info. please refer [1], [2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Enable_Django22_support_in_Horizon_Plugin

Change-Id: Ifc49a69d4b34b32d64a95cca488c3a1ab7eb2ef6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor-dashboard refs/changes/30/701330/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py37,pep8
deleted_lines: envlist = py37,py3-{dj111,dj22},pep8 dj111: pip install django>=1.11,<2 dj22: pip install django>=2.2,<2.3

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

karbor-dashboard is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/
Change-Id: Ic69bd25a9be7b512c0341e524e67e04f81217214

added_lines: envlist = py37,py3-{dj111,dj22},pep8

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Remove install_command from tox.ini as cleanup.
Switch to Ussuri jobs

Change-Id: I1a3b3e542f2a6cb03f98d80ec5685c315031eed7
Sem-Ver: api-break

- opendaylight

Some images will probably need to go to UNBUILDABLE:

- mongodb

Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8

commit_message:
WIP: move to CentOS 8 in containers

It is time to move to CentOS 8.

Still many things are missing:

- sensu
- shellinabox
- uwsgi-plugin-python3

We have to wait for Storage SIG, Virt SIG, OpsTools SIG etc.

Also external repos are not ready:

- elasticsearch
- grafana (albeit centos7 package installs)
- kibana
- HA (pacemaker, crmsh, corosync)
- td-agent
- opendaylight

Some images will probably need to go to UNBUILDABLE:

- mongodb

Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-python3

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/693544
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/702196

Change-Id: I05baddc1e3af257ddd50d0cc80efd3bea6125406

commit_message:
nova-net: Remove use of legacy 'SecurityGroup' object

While we can't remove this entirely, we can remove most of the users of
it. Do that.

Change-Id: Ie19ca6d5f9b7800ee43fdc72411cfe64f3eb7544
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Temporarily skipped to merge fix encoding/decoding in paging of universal describer class.

"Fix encoding/decoding in paging of universal describer class" is not related with temporarily skipped 5 tests, but cannot be merged with master unless all tests are passed. These 5 tests will be fixed by another bugfixes.

Change-Id: I7c965be70ca9a97615dd7d518eb2f6b82792e5a6

subject: Remove side-car containers in Create status
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-04 17:22:31.000000000', 'files': ['templates/neutron/keepalived.epp', 'templates/neutron/dibbler-client.epp', 'templates/neutron/haproxy.epp', 'templates/neutron/radvd.epp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/378580d3d8b3909c113e8d5c9bcae1fbf3315376', 'message': "Remove side-car containers in Create status

The change Ib3c41a8bee349856d21f360595e41a9eafd79323 added a mechanism
to remove side-car containers before spawning a new one for the same
network.

For dnsmasq side-car, it matches on container statuses Exited
and Created, while all remaining containers match on Exited only.
However if a node running side-car is shut down ungracefully, containers
end in Created status and wrapper script won't be able to start the
containers because they already exist.

This change goes only to Train because in current master (Ussuri) these
wrappers were replaced by ansible.

Change-Id: I7909cd18c7a123d64d24ebc33167d415a8cfb228
"}]
commit_message:
Remove side-car containers in Create status

The change Ib3c41a8bee349856d21f360595e41a9eafd79323 added a mechanism
to remove side-car containers before spawning a new one for the same
network.

For dnsmasq side-car, it matches on container statuses Exited
and Created, while all remaining containers match on Exited only.
However if a node running side-car is shut down ungracefully, containers
end in Created status and wrapper script won't be able to start the
containers because they already exist.

This change goes only to Train because in current master (Ussuri) these
wrappers were replaced by ansible.

Change-Id: I7909cd18c7a123d64d24ebc33167d415a8cfb228

subject: Remove log compression before upload
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-01-20 11:44:46.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/scripts-library.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/36fcb170b8a80203ec9e1ce7b860cd6926a4c32f', 'message': 'Remove log compression before upload

From #openstack-infra:
fungi> jrosser: there was a necessary change in handling of
compressed log files, jobs should not compress logs on their
own now if you want them to be viewable in a browser (this
was to solve a problem where tarballs were getting silently
decompressed on download without changing their filenames to
drop the .gz extension)

This is a patch direct to the Rocky branch as the log collection
is significantly refactored in Stein so the master branch change
cannot be backported to Rocky.

Change-Id: Ic96e23f93e989c982be99927b0883d9345ce1acd
'}]
commit_message:
Remove log compression before upload

From #openstack-infra:
fungi> jrosser: there was a necessary change in handling of
compressed log files, jobs should not compress logs on their
own now if you want them to be viewable in a browser (this
was to solve a problem where tarballs were getting silently
decompressed on download without changing their filenames to
drop the .gz extension)

This is a patch direct to the Rocky branch as the log collection
is significantly refactored in Stein so the master branch change
cannot be backported to Rocky.

Change-Id: Ic96e23f93e989c982be99927b0883d9345ce1acd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/74/703374/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: function compress_log_files { # We use 'command' to ensure that we're not executing with an alias. GZIP_CMD="command gzip --force --best" find_log_files |\ while read filename; do \ ${GZIP_CMD} ${filename} || echo "WARNING: Could not gzip ${filename}"; \ done } # Compress the files gathered so that they do not take up too much space. if [ "$GATE_EXIT_LOG_GZIP" == true ]; then compress_log_files fi

commit_message:
Fix pep8 error in py37

While running PEP8 in python3.7 environment, will met the
following exception:
"RuntimeError: generator raised StopIteration"
This is an known issue in py3.7, and had been fixed in Pylint 2.x.

After upgrade Pylint to 2.2.0, the issue is:
"AttributeError: 'Import' object has no
attribute 'infer_name_module' on import"
This issue was fixed in Pylint 2.3.0.

So upgrades Pylint to 2.3.0, this patch also
adds some refactor recommendations in .pylintrc[1]

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/789057/

Change-Id: I2b3983e3653d92c5b12f233b57fb4467df1da83d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/20/705420/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pylint==2.3.0 # GPLv2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-01-09 18:59:10.000000000', 'files': ['sushy/tests/unit/resources/system/test_simple_storage.py', 'sushy/resources/system/simple_storage.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-simple-storage-device-capacity-bytes-null-0672eed36d9da70a.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sushy/commit/2f961fc3e5e34ceab8713eec4c2ceaec84da0391', 'message': 'SSC.disks_sizes_bytes handle CapacityBytes is None

In the open ocean, a Redfish service can return a SimpleStorage resource
containing a Device property with its CapacityBytes property set to
null. According to the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) schema
for SimpleStorage, the type of CapacityBytes can be either integer or
null [1].

The Dell integrated Dell Remote Access Controller (iDRAC) 9 running
Lifecycle Controller firmware version 3.30.30.30 returns that for a Dell
EMC PowerEdge R740xd containing a Dell HBA 330 12Gbps SAS Host Bus

[1] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/SimpleStorage.v1_2_3.json

Story: 2006918
Task: 37567
(cherry picked from commit 9d01756833ec97a05f301a4fa1e8b2511d7c5c74)
'}]
commit_message:
SSC.disks_sizes_bytes handle CapacityBytes is None

In the open ocean, a Redfish service can return a SimpleStorage resource
containing a Device property with its CapacityBytes property set to
null. According to the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) schema
for SimpleStorage, the type of CapacityBytes can be either integer or
null [1].

The Dell integrated Dell Remote Access Controller (iDRAC) 9 running
Lifecycle Controller firmware version 3.30.30.30 returns that for a Dell
EMC PowerEdge R740xd containing a Dell HBA 330 12Gbps SAS Host Bus
Adapter Controller (non-RAID), MiniCard (HBA 330 Mini) [2]. The HBA 330
Mini firmware version is 16.17.00.03.

The same was observed against an R740xd running Lifecycle Controller
firmware version 3.34.34.34.

This changes the SimpleStorageCollection.disks_size_bytes property to
process only Disks with CapacityByes not set to None.

[1] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/SimpleStorage.v1_2_3.json
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2019-12-11.log.html#t2019-12-11T07:24:17

Change-Id: I57a0074a7f6c4495e7c73a00c87675ea87fdb6e8
Story: 2006918
Task: 37567
(cherry picked from commit 9d01756833ec97a05f301a4fa1e8b2511d7c5c74)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/07/701807/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes bug in ``SimpleStorageCollection.disks_sizes_bytes`` which assumed the type of a disk's ``CapacityBytes`` property is ``integer``. According to the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) Redfish standard schema [1], it can be ``null``, which is converted to ``None`` in Python. For more information, see `story 2006918 <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2006918>`_. [1] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/SimpleStorage.v1_2_3.json

commit_message:
Support node retirement

This change adds support for node retirement: nodes can
have additional properties 'retired' and 'retired_reason'
which change the way the nodes (can) traverse the FSM
and which operations are allowed. In particular:
- retired nodes cannot move from manageable to available;
- upon instance deletion, retired nodes move to manageable
  (rather than available).

Story: #2005425
Task: #38142

Change-Id: I8113a44c28f62bf83f8e213aeb6704f96055d52b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/81/703981/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :retired: True | False

commit_message:
Support query user messages by timestamp

Add support for querying user messages by specifying a timestamp, which
will be compared to the created_at field, and manila will return all the
messages matching to the time condition.

Partially-Implements: blueprint query-user-message-by-timestamp

Change-Id: I357c198990a92e2ac61ece24df129f9878aa7b64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila-specs refs/changes/30/692330/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================================================= Support to query user messages filter by comparison timestamp ============================================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/manila/+spec/query-user-message-by-timestamp Support users can query user messages by specifying the timestamp comparison along with created_at, and manila will return all which matches the time condition. Problem description =================== Manila API only support filtering user messages by discrete values(such as message_id or resource_id), even though user messages have timestamp fields as created_at, users can not query by given period. Users may be interested in user messages in a specific period for analyze the causes of asynchronous errors but currently they have to retrieve and filter the resources by themselves. This change can bring facility to users and also improve the efficiency of timestamp based query. Use Cases ========= In large scale environment, lots of asynchronous error message maybe created in table messages, for quickly locate the cause of resource error, user or manage system only need to get use messages about the resource which was created during specified time period, instead of querying all asynchronous error message of the resource. Proposed change =============== * Introduce two more parameters to the url of query user messages, the value of parameter is timestamp. * parameter 'created_before': Return results older than the specified time. * parameter 'created_since': Return results more recent than the specified time. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- List user messages API will accept new query string parameters. User can add created_before to the url to query user messages that before specified time, and created_since to query user messages that after specified time, or use both them to query user messages that during specified time period. This changes also need to bump the microversion of API to keep forward compatibility. * GET /v2/{project_id}/messages?created_since=2019-11-01T01:00:00&created_before=2019-11-02T01:00:00 Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- Python client may add help to inform users this new filter. It is easy to support this new filter. Performance Impact ------------------ Performance can be improved for timestamp based query by utilizing database engine. Additional, it also can add index to improve querying performance. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: haixin<haixin@inspur.com> Work Items ---------- * Add API filter * Add querying support in sql * Add related test * Add python client support Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= 1. Unit test to test if those filters can be correctly applied. 2. Tempest test if change filter work correctly from API perspective. Documentation Impact ==================== 1. The manila API documentation will need to be updated to reflect the REST API changes. References ========== None

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ibea136743f9a82d0e9ff35bc59f54a4c8afda74b

commit_message:
Minor improvements to cell commands

It adds a bit more verbosity to cell update command, so that it
is more obvious for an operator which values are being used as
transport URL or database connection URL for a cell.

Change-Id: Ie567ae7da4508a4b6f797d4bc77347c84702a74e

added_lines: def _validate_transport_url(self, transport_url, warn_about_none=True): if not transport_url: if not CONF.transport_url: if warn_about_none: print(_( 'Must specify --transport-url if ' '[DEFAULT]/transport_url is not set in the ' 'configuration file.')) return None print(_('--transport-url not provided in the command line, ' 'using the value [DEFAULT]/transport_url from the ' 'configuration file')) transport_url = CONF.transport_url def _validate_database_connection( self, database_connection, warn_about_none=True): if not database_connection: if not CONF.database.connection: if warn_about_none: print(_( 'Must specify --database_connection if ' '[database]/connection is not set in the ' 'configuration file.')) return None print(_('--database_connection not provided in the command line, ' 'using the value [database]/connection from the ' 'configuration file')) return CONF.database.connection return database_connection database_connection = self._validate_database_connection( database_connection) if not database_connection: # Having empty transport_url and db_connection means leaving the # existing values transport_url = self._validate_transport_url( transport_url, warn_about_none=False) db_connection = self._validate_database_connection( db_connection, warn_about_none=False)
deleted_lines: def _validate_transport_url(self, transport_url): transport_url = transport_url or CONF.transport_url if not transport_url: print('Must specify --transport-url if [DEFAULT]/transport_url ' 'is not set in the configuration file.') return None database_connection = database_connection or CONF.database.connection if not database_connection: print(_('Must specify --database_connection ' 'if [database]/connection is not set ' 'in the configuration file.')) transport_url = transport_url or CONF.transport_url db_connection = db_connection or CONF.database.connection

commit_message:
CentOS 8: Deploy CentOS 8 containers

* HAProxy is now 1.8 in CentOS 8
* Support python3 in baremetal role
* Remove support for environments without python2 installed (this could
  not have worked since we gather facts before this point)

Workarounds:

* Using CentOS 7 yum repo for Docker, with module_hotfixes

Change-Id: I30bd3d58f6224ad4c9575ba66c74deabe6895cc4
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8

commit_message:
Ensure tox registers failures properly

Tox runs tests via unit_tests.sh which when not
running a test subset will mean tox only checks for
the final exit code. This means horizon test failues
will not be seen by tox unless openstack_dashboard
tests also fail.

This change forces an exit code which !=0 if either
test run fails.

Change-Id: I8fbcb834d9817e7eea1b2c39fc4caab6004b981b
(cherry picked from commit 280848c55ffeb8cfe948acd5f2ca234d2c1264f5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/02/701902/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: horizon_tests=$? openstack_dashboard_tests=$? # we have to tell tox if either of these test runs failed if [[ $horizon_tests != 0 || $openstack_dashboard_tests != 0 ]]; then exit 1; fi

commit_message:
operation_log: Log mask_fields only when exists in request

Previously mask_fields are always output even when they are
not included in a user request. It is confusing.

Change-Id: Ia207bfbc61246bc722a2ced544a8955f52025c0c
Closes-Bug: #1675191
(cherry picked from commit d04f164ab2d2472e181226201a68feaaf1454450)

subject: mysql: configure maximum connection lifetime
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-01-16 09:31:13.000000000', 'files': ['src/templates/vault.hcl.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-vault/commit/a2f90f6e890add09753ef804f21a360eecc3bfbd', 'message': "mysql: configure maximum connection lifetime

Ensure that any server side termination of MySQL connections is
handled well by configuring a maximum connection lifetime of
3600 seconds. This is inline with defaults in OpenStack/oslo.db
and is typically equal to or less that the wait_timeout configured
in MySQL or Percona XtraDB Cluster.  The default is '0' which
means connections will be used forever.

Longer term solution to this issue is to pass the configured
wait_timeout in MySQL on the shared-db relation so clients can
